dcterms:creator: K. Hermann
T. Kocisky
E. Grefenstette
L. Espeholt
W. Kay
M. Suleyman
P. Blunsom
dcterms:description: The CNN-DM corpus is the most commonly used corpus for news summarization, comprising articles and their corresponding summaries, which are structured as bullet points.
dcterms:title: CNN-DM corpus

dcterms:creator: K. Filippova
Y. Altun
dcterms:description: The Google sentence compression dataset consists of 200,000 sentence-headline pairs from news articles, where the headlines are created by pruning the syntactic tree of the sentences.
dcterms:title: Google sentence compression dataset

dcterms:creator: A. M. Rush
S. Chopra
J. Weston
dcterms:description: Gigaword is a large-scale dataset that includes a vast collection of news articles and their corresponding summaries, often used for training models in text summarization.
dcterms:title: Gigaword

dcterms:creator: M. Richardson
C. J. C. Burges
E. Renshaw
dcterms:description: MCTest is a challenge dataset designed for the open-domain machine comprehension of text, consisting of multiple-choice questions based on short stories.
dcterms:title: MCTest

dcterms:creator: P. Rajpurkar
J. Zhang
K. Lopyrev
P. Liang
dcterms:description: SQuAD is a large-scale dataset containing over 100,000 questions for machine comprehension of text, where each question is based on a paragraph from Wikipedia.
dcterms:title: SQuAD

dcterms:creator: H. Stephenson
dcterms:description: The Interactive reading practice dataset by National Geographic consists of texts designed for reading practice, aimed at improving comprehension skills across different levels.
dcterms:title: Interactive reading practice by National Geographic
